intro: Scorzonera pseudotomentosa, commonly known as the woolly scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features hairy, gray-green leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically yellow with a central disk, and it produces small, rounded seeds in a pappus. Scorzonera pseudotomentosa is often found in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
